[[Image:Backsaws.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Three backsaws: dōzuki (top), Gent's saw and Tenon saw]]
A '''backsaw''' is any [[hand saw]] which has a stiffening rib on the edge opposite the [[Blade|cutting edge]], enabling better control and more precise cutting than with other types of saws. Backsaws are normally used in [[woodworking]] for precise work, such as cutting [[Dovetail joint|dovetails]], [[miter joint|mitres]], or [[mortise and tenon|tenons]] in [[cabinet making|cabinetry]] and [[joiner]]y. Because of the stiffening rib, backsaws are limited in the depth to which they can cut. Backsaws usually have relatively closely spaced teeth, often with little or no set.
==Types of backsaws==
Backsaws include the '''tenon saw''', the '''dovetail saw''', and the (United Kingdom) '''sash saw'''<sup id="fn_1_back">[[#fn 1|1]]</sup>. Tenon and dovetail saws usually have a [[pistol grip]] style handle which may be open or closed at the bottom.
Different types of backsaw include: * '''[[Miter saw|Mitre saw]]''' – often referred to as a large backsaw (20–30 inches or 60–90 cm) used either in a wooden or metal [[mitre box]] or in a metal frame which allowed cutting mitres of any specified angle. Note that not all mitre saws are backsaws, and the electric mitre saw (or chop saw) has largely taken its place today. * '''Tenon saw''' – a midsized backsaw. The saw derives its name from its use in the cutting of tenons for [[mortise and tenon]] joinery. Tenon saws are commonly available with rip-filed teeth for rip cutting and cross-cut for cutting across the grain. Teeth are relatively fine, with 13 teeth per inch being a common size for the saw. * '''Sash saw''' – name that seems to have been used in the 18th and 19th century for a smaller tenon saw, used in fabricating [[window sash]]es. The term is also used currently to refer to a thin, flexible saw used to free sashes that have been painted shut. * '''Dovetail saw''' – a small backsaw used to cut [[dovetail joint|dovetails]]. These saws will usually have a higher number of teeth per inch (around 15 - 20 T.P.I.) with teeth sharpened in a rip tooth pattern and minimal set to leave a narrow kerf. This fine rip tooth pattern also works well in cross cutting operations. * '''Gent's saw''' or '''Gentleman's saw''' (rare) – a small dovetail saw with a straight turned handle, rather than an open one typical of most saws. The name seems to have arisen from its use by the nineteenth century dilettante who would now be called a [[hobby]]ist but it is hard to find a nineteenth century reference to it. For example, in the section on tools in ''Every Man his own Mechanic'' (1881) (816pp), tenon, dovetail and [[sash saw]]s are listed as a group but there is no mention of a gent's saw. It is adapted for use in making joints in very small woodwork such as that in some [[musical instrument]]s, [[Doll|dolls' furniture]] or other [[Scale model|model-making]]. Its distinguishing features are its small size and turned handle. * '''Razor saw''' – a very small backsaw having very finely pitched [[Crosscut saw|crosscut]] teeth, often with no set. The Razor saw is used by hobbyists, notably [[Model aircraft]], [[Model yachting|boat]], and [[Rail transport modelling|railroad]] enthusiasts. Razor saws typically use disposable blades (or are occasionally designed to be completely disposable), since their teeth are so small as to be impractical to re-sharpen. A razor saw is capable of making clean cuts in very soft woods like [[Balsa]], which most other saws would tend to tear out. Unlike most other types of backsaws, razor saws are also frequently used to cut plastics and soft metals. * '''Dōzuki''' – a [[japanese saw|Japanese backsaw]], used for centuries by carpenters and cabinetmakers in Japan. Although this saw does not share an ancestry with the other backsaws in this group, the concept is the same. Like most Japanese saws, the dōzuki cuts on the pull stroke, allowing much straighter and narrower cuts than those achieved with push-stroke saws. This is due to tension on the blade during the cut (versus compression for a western saw), so less thickness is required to keep the saw blade straight.
==Design== [[File:Backsaw.jpeg|thumb|300px|Flush-cutting Backsaw, handle can be turned to the other side]] The work of a backsaw requires a thin, stiff blade. These two immediately incompatible requirements are resolved by [[Swage|swaging]] (and perhaps, [[spot welding]]) a stiffening cap over the length of the top edge of the blade. This thickening of the blade is the back and is generally made from some kind of metal, usually brass or steel. The stiffening back is carried through into the handle so that the blade does not bend between the two. The thickening of the back limits the depth to which the saw can cut but this is generally not a limitation in their typical uses.
==Associated tools== * A backsaw is often used in combination with a [[mitre box]] to produce precisely angled cuts. * Another accessory commonly used is the [[bench hook]]. * Another tool associated with the use of backsaws is the [[marking knife]]. This leaves a cleaner line than a pencil would and it cuts the fibres at the surface of the wood. Without this, the action of the saw would lift them and leave a ragged edge.
==References== * Young, F. ''Every Man his own Mechanic'' (1881) * ''Oxford English Dictionary'' (1978) {{ISBN|0-19-861212-5}} * Hazra choudhary, ''A text book on workshop technology''
==Footnotes== * <cite id="fn_1">[[#fn 1 back|Note 1:]]</cite> In North America, the name sash saw is used for a [[frame saw]] used in [[sawmill]]ing.
{{Woodworking}}
[[Category:Saws]] [[Category:Woodworking hand tools]] [[Category:Woodworking]]

{{Infobox automobile | name = Buick Regal | image = Buick Regal 2018 (cropped).jpg | caption = 2018 Buick Regal | manufacturer = [[Buick]] ([[General Motors]]) | aka = [[Opel Insignia]] (Europe)
[[Vauxhall Motors|Vauxhall]] Insignia (UK)
[[Holden Commodore (ZB)]] (Australasia) | model_years = '''North America'''
1973–2004
2011–present
'''China'''
1999–present | class = [[Mid-size|Mid-size car]] ([[D-segment|D]]) (1973-1987, 2009-present)
[[Mid-size]] [[Luxury car|luxury car]] ([[E-segment|E]]) (1988-2004) | sp = us | predecessor = [[Buick Skylark#1968–1972|Buick Skylark]] (1972) | successor = [[Buick LaCrosse]] (for Regal, 1988-2004) }} The '''Buick Regal''' is an upscale [[mid-size]]d [[car|automobile]] that was first introduced by [[Buick]] for the 1973 model year. [[North America]]n production ended in 2004 and began again in 2011. For the 2011 model year, [[Buick]] re-introduced the Regal to the [[North America]]n market, positioned as an upscale [[sports sedan]].{{cite press release|date=2009-11-12|url=http://media.gm.com/content/media/us/en/news/news_detail.brand_gm.html/content/Pages/news/us/en/2009/Nov/1112_GM_Buick_Regal|publisher=GM Media Online|title=The 2011 Regal: A Buick Bred On The Autobahn}} Production and sales in [[China]] have continued since 1999. For certain model years between 1973 and 2004, the Regal shared bodies and powertrains with the similar [[Buick Century]]. The two most recent generations (2011–present) are North American market versions of the [[Opel Insignia]], known as the [[Vauxhall Motors|Vauxhall]] Insignia in the [[United Kingdom|UK]]. == First generation (1973–1977) == {{Infobox automobile | name = First generation | image = File:Buick Regal (2386033959).jpg | caption = 1973 Buick Regal sedan | aka = Buick Century Regal | model_years = 1973–1977 | assembly = {{unbulleted list|United States: [[Flint, Michigan]] ([[Buick City]])|[[Framingham, Massachusetts]] ([[Framingham Assembly]])|[[Fremont, California]] ([[Fremont Assembly]])|[[Lakewood Heights, Atlanta|Lakewood Heights, Georgia]] ([[Lakewood Assembly]])}} | engine = {{unbulleted list|{{convert|231|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} ''[[Buick V6 engine#231|Buick]]'' [[V6 engine|V6]] (gasoline)|{{convert|350|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} ''[[Buick V8 engine#350|Buick]]'' [[V8 engine|V8]] (gasoline)|{{convert|455|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} ''[[Buick V8 engine#455|Buick]]'' [[V8 engine|V8]] (gasoline)}} | transmission = {{unbulleted list|3-speed ''[[Turbo-Hydramatic]] [[Turbo-Hydramatic#THM350|350]]'' automatic|3-speed ''[[Turbo-Hydramatic]] [[Turbo-Hydramatic#Super Turbine 400 .2F THM400 .2F THM375 .2F 3L80 .2F 3L80HD|400]]'' automatic}} | wheelbase = {{unbulleted list|{{convert|112|in|mm|abbr=on}} (coupe)|{{convert|116|in|mm|abbr=on}} (sedan){{cite web|author=Dusan Ristic-Petrovic |url=http://oldcarbrochures.com/new/021110/1974%20Buick%20Century/1974%20Buick%20Century-06.html |title=File: 1974 Buick Century/1974 Buick Century-06 |publisher=Oldcarbrochures.com |date= |accessdate=2012-01-08}}}} | length = {{unbulleted list|{{convert|212|in|mm|abbr=on}} (coupe)|{{convert|216|in|mm|abbr=on}} (sedan)}} | height = {{unbulleted list|{{convert|53.3|in|mm|abbr=on}} (coupe)|{{convert|54.1|in|mm|abbr=on}} (sedan)}} | body_style = 2-door [[coupe]]
4-door [[Sedan (automobile)|sedan]] | related = {{unbulleted list|[[Buick Century#1973.E2.80.931977|Buick Century]]|[[Chevrolet El Camino#Fourth generation .281973.E2.80.931977.29|Chevrolet El Camino]]|[[Chevrolet Chevelle#Third generation .281973.E2.80.931977.29|Chevrolet Malibu]]|[[Chevrolet Monte Carlo#Second generation|Chevrolet Monte Carlo]]|[[Oldsmobile Cutlass#Fourth Generation - 1973.E2.80.931977|Oldsmobile Cutlass]]|[[Oldsmobile Cutlass Supreme#Third generation .281973.E2.80.931977.29|Oldsmobile Cutlass Supreme]]|[[Pontiac Grand Am#1973.E2.80.931975|Pontiac Grand Am]]|[[Pontiac Grand Prix#Third generation .281973.E2.80.931977.29|Pontiac Grand Prix]]}} | platform = [[GM A platform (RWD)|A-body]] | layout = [[FR layout]] | sp = us }} [[File:Nona6.jpg|thumb|left|1973 Buick Regal coupe]] [[File:Buick-Regal-(A-body)-Vilnius-Lithuania-front.jpg|thumb|left|1976 Buick Regal sedan (front view)]] [[File:Buick-Regal-(A-body)-Vilnius-Lithuania-back.jpg|thumb|left|1976 Buick Regal sedan (rear view)]] [[Buick]] had been the first GM division to bring a [[personal luxury car]] to market with its full-size 1963 [[Buick Riviera|Riviera]], but was otherwise slow to react to the developing lower-priced mid-size personal luxury market, which [[Pontiac]] created with the 1969 [[Pontiac Grand Prix|Grand Prix]] and [[Chevrolet]] with the [[Chevrolet Monte Carlo|Monte Carlo]] the following year, 1970. At the same time, [[Oldsmobile]] added a formal notchback coupé to its intermediate line, the [[Cutlass Supreme]], in 1970 and that model soon became Olds' best selling intermediate. Buick did not get its own personal luxury coupe until the GM intermediates were redesigned in 1973, the so-called "Colonnade" cars that eliminated hardtop models completely. In a curious name swap, the Skylark name was dropped from Buick's intermediate line and instead the Century nameplate, last used in the 1950s, was revived for them. A highly trimmed, two-door [[coupe]], the first Regal shared its front and rear styling with its Century parent with distinctions amounting to differing grilles and taillight lenses. The Regal shared the same "Colonnade" [[Hardtop|pillared hardtop]] roofline (a [[hardtop]] with [[Pillar (car)|B-pillars (center pillars)]] but frameless doors unlike a sedan body) and greenhouse (window area) with the Grand Prix, Monte Carlo, and Cutlass Supreme as well as the lower-priced Buick Century Luxus coupe. Like its corporate cousins, the Regal (and Luxus) featured the newly fashionable opera windows, which were small fixed rear-side windows surrounded by sheetmetal, instead of the traditional roll-down windows. For the first [[model year]] in 1973, the Regal nameplate was only used for Buick's version of the GM intermediate [[personal luxury car|personal luxury]] [[coupe]], but the following year gained a [[sedan (car)|sedan]] companion (there was no Regal [[station wagon]]). Regal interiors were generally more luxurious than lesser Century models with woodgrain trim on [[dashboard]] and [[door panel]]s, along with door-pull straps and [[bench seat]]s with center [[armrest]]s with cloth, velour, or vinyl upholstery. Optionally available throughout the run was a 60/40 split bench seat with [[armrest]]. For 1976 and 1977, the Regal [[coupé|coupe]] was available with the S/R option that included reclining bucket seats with corduroy upholstery. The model lasted five years with minimal changes, although there was a fairly substantial facelift in coupes for 1976 (sedans retained their original 1973 sheetmetal through 1977), which incorporated the recently-legalized square headlights (horizontally mounted on coupes, and vertically on [[sedan (car)|sedan]]s—much like the mid-1960s Pontiacs). The Regal coupe sold reasonably well, although it lagged behind the Monte Carlo and Cutlass Supreme which had become the best-selling cars in America by 1976. The Regal was most commonly powered by [[Buick V8 engine#350|Buick's 350 in³ V8]], which was standard equipment on all models for 1973 and 1974, and optional on coupes but standard on sedans from 1975 to 1977, and the larger [[Buick V8 engine#455|455 cu in V8]] was optional for 1973 and 1974 models only. Starting in 1975, Regal coupes came standard with Buick's resurrected {{convert|231|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} [[V6 engine]] previously offered on the 1964–1967 [[Buick Skylark|Skylark]]; the engine's tooling had been sold to [[Kaiser Motors]] for use in [[Jeep]] models (Kaiser was purchased by American Motors in 1970 and Jeep became an AMC division) and sold back to GM by AMC in 1974. For 1975 and 1976, the Century and Regal were the only mid-sized cars in America to offer V6 engines. The bolt pattern for this vehicle is 5×{{convert|4+3/4|in|mm|1}}. The Century designation was quietly dropped from the Regal for 1975. {{clear}} == Second generation (1978–1987) == {{Infobox automobile | name = Second generation | image = '87 Buick Regal Grand National (Auto classique A&W Châteauguay '12).JPG | caption = 1987 Buick Regal Grand National | model_years = 1978–1987 | layout = [[FR layout]] | assembly = United States: {{ubl |[[Flint, Michigan]] |[[Lakewood Heights, Atlanta|Lakewood Heights, Georgia]] |[[Arlington, Texas]] |[[Framingham, Massachusetts]] |[[Fremont, California]] |[[Pontiac, Michigan]] |[[Kansas City, Missouri]] (Leeds) }} | wheelbase = {{convert|108|in|mm|1|abbr=on}} | related = {{ubl |[[Buick Century]] |[[Chevrolet El Camino]] |[[Chevrolet Malibu]] |[[Chevrolet Monte Carlo]] |[[Oldsmobile Cutlass]] |[[Oldsmobile Cutlass Supreme]] |[[Pontiac Bonneville]] |[[Pontiac Grand Am]] |[[Pontiac Grand Prix]] |[[Pontiac Le Mans]] }} | engine = {{ubl |{{convert|196|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} [[Buick V6 engine#3.2|Buick V6]] |{{convert|231|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} [[Buick V6 engine#LD5|Buick V6]] |{{convert|231|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} [[Buick V6 engine#LD5|Buick V6]] [[Turbocharger|Turbocharged]] |{{convert|252|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} [[Buick V6 engine#4.1|Buick V6]] |{{convert|260|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} [[Oldsmobile Diesel engine|Oldsmobile Diesel]] [[V6 engine|V6]] |{{convert|265|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} [[Pontiac V8 engine#265|Pontiac V8]] |{{convert|301|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} [[Pontiac V8 engine#301|Pontiac V8]] |{{convert|305|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} [[Chevrolet Small-Block engine#305|Chevrolet]] [[V8 engine|V8]] |{{convert|307|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} [[Oldsmobile V8 engine#307|Oldsmobile V8]] |{{convert|350|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} [[Oldsmobile Diesel engine|Oldsmobile Diesel]] [[V8 engine|V8]] }} | transmission = {{ubl |3-speed [[manual transmission|manual]] |3-speed [[Turbo-Hydramatic#THM200|THM200]] [[automatic transmission|automatic]] |4-speed [[Turbo-Hydramatic#THM200-4R|THM200-4R]] automatic }} | body_style = 2-door [[coupé]]
4-door [[sedan (car)|sedan]]
4-door [[station wagon]] | platform = [[GM A platform (RWD)|A-body]] (1978–1981)
[[GM G platform (RWD)|G-body]] (1981–1987) | sp = us }} A downsized Regal appeared for the 1978 model year with Buick's new {{convert|196|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} [[V6 engine]] as standard equipment and a revised version of the venerable {{convert|231|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} V6 as an option (which became standard for 1980). Initially, a 3-speed [[manual transmission]] was standard but this was later replaced by an automatic. This model lasted 10 years. The base model was equipped with softer-riding luxury [[Suspension (vehicle)|suspension]], and did not offer a manual transmission in later years. [[File:Buick Regal -- 08-14-2009.jpg|thumb|left|1978–1979 Buick Regal]] [[File:Regal A-Body.JPG|thumb|left|1980 Buick Regal]] [[File:Buick Regal G-Body.jpg|thumb|left|1982–1987 Buick Regal]] The 1978 Regal could be equipped with a {{convert|3791|cc|L CID|1|abbr=on}} [[Turbocharged]] V6 engine with [[automatic transmission]] and the [[Sedan (automobile)|sedan model]] was dropped, once again leaving Regals exclusively as [[coupé]]s with the [[Buick Century|Century]] nameplate applied to bread-and-butter sedans and [[station wagon]]s. Non-turbo versions were offered with either a 2-bbl or a 4-bbl [[carburetor]]. The [[Buick LeSabre]] was also available with the turbocharged engine. The only other turbocharged cars available in the U.S. market in 1978 were imports from [[Mercedes-Benz]], [[Porsche 930|Porsche]] and [[Saab Automobile|Saab]]. The Turbo Regal also included a firm [[Car handling|handling]] suspension with larger tires and sport [[Rim (wheel)|wheels]]. A major facelift for 1981 gave the Regal a much more aerodynamic profile, helping make it possible for the car to compete on the [[NASCAR]] racing circuit. The sloping [[Hood (car)|hood]] and nose of the car made it the favorite of several NASCAR teams. [[Richard Petty]] drove one to victory in the [[1981 Daytona 500]], and the car won a majority of the 1981 and 1982 seasons races and won the NASCAR manufacturers title in 1981 and 1982. [[V8 engine|V8]]s for street use were still available, but had shrunk to {{convert|265|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} (1980 and 1981 only, [[Pontiac]] built), and the V6 was rapidly gaining popularity. In January 1982, a new Century appeared on the [[front-wheel drive]] [[GM A platform (FWD)|A-body]], but the former [[rear-wheel drive]] Century sedan and wagon were not discontinued. These models were simply [[Badge|rebadged]] as Regals, and for the first time the name appeared on a full model lineup. The wagon was discontinued after 1983, and the sedan dropped from the lineup the next year. From 1986 to 1987, the [[Oldsmobile V8 engine#307|{{convert|307|CID|L|1|abbr=on}} V8]] was available as an option. The {{convert|3791|cc|L CID|1|abbr=on}} 2-bbl V6 was standard. The [[Turbo-Hydramatic#THM200-4R|200-4R]] [[Overdrive (mechanics)|overdrive]] [[Transmission (mechanics)|transmission]] was an option with either engine. === Somerset Limited Edition === For 1980, the Regal was offered in a special Somerset Limited Edition [[Trim level (automobile)|trim]] which featured unique tan and dark blue designer exterior paint, wire wheel covers, sport [[Wing mirror|mirrors]], and chrome Somerset badging. The interior had tan and blue plush [[velour]] [[Upholstery#Automobile upholstery|upholstery]], brushed [[Chrome plating#Automotive use|chrome]] trim, and additional Somerset badging. A Somerset Limited Edition model was also offered on the restyled 1981 Regal. It had unique dark sandstone and camel exterior paint, sport mirrors, and turbine wheels. The interior plush velour upholstery was camel with dark brown piping. === Grand National, Turbo-T, T-Type, and GNX === In February 1982, the Regal Grand National debuted, which was named for the [[NASCAR Sprint Cup Series|NASCAR Winston Cup Grand National Series]] (the "Grand National" term was part of the Cup series nomenclature until 1986).http://legendarydreamcargarage.com/dreamcargarage/539 Buick had won the Manufacturers Cup in 1981 and 1982, and wanted to capitalize on its success: "What wins on Sunday, sells on Monday". These 1982 cars were not painted black, which may confuse those not familiar with them. All started out as charcoal gray Regals that were shipped off to a subcontractor for finishing. Originally intended for a run of 100 units, Cars and Concepts of [[Brighton, Michigan]], retrofitted 215 Regals with the GN package. Most obvious was the light silver gray firemist paint added to each side. Red [[Pinstriping#Automobiles|pinstripes]] and billboard shadow lettering proclaiming "Buick" were applied. The wheel opening moldings and [[rocker panel]] moldings were blacked out using black vinyl tape. Finally, a front air dam and [[rear spoiler]] were installed. On the inside, special "Lear-Siegler" seats were installed. These seats are fully adjustable and were covered with silver brandon cloth with black vinyl inserts. The front seat had Buick's "6" emblem embroidered onto them. Also, a special clock delete plate was added to the [[Dashboard|instrument panel]] which contained the yellow and orange "6" logo and the words "Grand National Buick Motor Division".) The 1982 GN came with a [[naturally aspirated]] {{convert|252|CID|L|1|abbr=on}} V6 engine with {{convert|125|hp|PS kW|0|abbr=on}} at 4,000 rpm and {{convert|205|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} of [[torque]] at 2,000 rpm. Of the 215 Regal Grand Nationals produced in 1982, at least 35 were based on the Buick Regal Sport coupe package with the turbocharged {{convert|3791|cc|L CID|1|abbr=on}} V6 engine with {{convert|175|hp|PS kW|0|abbr=on}} at 4,000 rpm and {{convert|275|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} of torque at 2,600 rpm. There were only 2,022 Sport coupes produced in 1982, and the number of cars with both the GN and Sport coupe packages is estimated to be fewer than 50. For 1983, there was no Grand National. The Sport coupe model was renamed the [[T-Type]]; 3,732 were produced ({{convert|190|hp|PS kW|0|abbr=on}} at 1,600 rpm and {{convert|280|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} of torque at 2,400 rpm). The T-Type had been used on other Buicks, starting with the [[Buick Riviera|Riviera]] in 1981 (in 1979 and 1980, it was the S Type). The 1983 Regal T-Type featured tube [[Exhaust manifold|headers]], Hydro-Boost II [[brake]]s, 200-4R 4-speed overdrive trans and 3.42 [[rear axle]] (7.5").{{cite web|url=http://www.autotraderclassics.com/car-article/Future+Collectible%3A+1986+Buick+Grand+National*T_Type-66683.xhtml |title=Buick Grand National Buyer's Guide |publisher=Autotraderclassics.com |date= |accessdate=2010-10-10}} [[File:Buick T-Type (2669441886).jpg|thumb|Buick Regal T-Type]] For 1984, the Grand National returned, now in all black paint. The [[turbocharged]] {{convert|3791|cc|L CID|1|abbr=on}} became standard and was refined with [[sequential fuel injection]], [[distributor]]-less computer controlled [[Ignition system|ignition]], and boasted {{convert|200|hp|PS kW|0|abbr=on}} at 4,400 rpm and {{convert|300|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} of torque at 2,400 rpm. Only 5,204 turbo Regals were produced that year, only 2,000 of which were Grand Nationals. Because this was the first year production of the computer controlled sequential fuel injection and distributor-less ignition, this is often considered the year and model that started the development of the legendary [[intercooled]] Grand Nationals. The performance of this package was well ahead of its time and the "little V6" easily kept up with the bigger V8s. [[Dragstrip|{{convert|1/4|mi|m|0}}]] performance was listed at 15.9 seconds at stock boost levels of {{convert|10|psi|bar|abbr=on}}, while for the same year, the [[Chevrolet Camaro (third generation)|Chevrolet Camaro]] was listed at 17.0 and the [[Chevrolet Corvette (C4)|Chevrolet Corvette]] at 15.2 seconds. {{Cite web |url=http://www.caranddriver.com/reviews/1984-chevrolet-corvette-c4-archived-road-test |title=1984 Corvette (C4) |date=1983-03-01 |publisher=Car and Driver }} Soon, performance enthusiasts determined the modifications that worked and the Grand Nationals easily broke into the 13-second territory. All Grand Nationals had the [[Lear Siegler]]-made cloth/leather interior which was only available for this year. An estimated 200 of the 1984 Grand Nationals were produced with the T-Top option which makes these the rarest of the Grand Nationals. For 1986, a modified engine design with air-air intercooling boosted the performance even further to a specified {{convert|235|hp|PS kW|0|abbr=on}} at 4,000 rpm and {{convert|330|lbft|0|abbr=on}} of torque at 2,400 rpm. The Grand Nationals (quantity 5,512) and T-Types (quantity 2,384) were both produced in 1986. For 1987, performance reached {{convert|245|hp|PS kW|0|abbr=on}} and {{convert|355|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} of torque. Buick dropped the T-Type package for Regal for 1987 models and opted for a "T" sport package instead. There were only 7,896 turbo Regals produced in 1986. In 1987, when turbo Regals reached their peak in popularity, a total of 27,590 turbo Regals were produced through December, with those models produced between September and December of that year window stickered as "1987½ Buick Grand National" vehicles. [[File:WO2T.jpg|thumb|1987 Regal turbo-T Limited with rare blackout trim package]] For 1987, a lightweight WE4 (turbo T) option was offered. Only 1,547 of this variant were produced. The differences between a WE4 and the Grand National were the interior trim package, wheels, exterior badging, aluminum [[Bumper (car)|bumper]] supports, and aluminum rear [[drum brake]]s as opposed to the Grand National's [[cast iron]], making the WE4 a lighter and faster car. The rear spoiler was only available as a [[Car dealership|dealer]] installed option. Nineteen eighty-seven was the only year that the LC2 turbo option was available on any Regal, making it possible to even see a Limited with a vinyl [[Landau (automobile)|landau roof]] and a [[power bulge]] turbo hood. Turbo Regal Limiteds were one of the rarest models of turbo Regals produced second only to the GNX at 1,035 turbo Limiteds. Turbo Regal Limiteds could be ordered with many options with most having chrome external trim but for $35 could have been built with the full black-out trim option making them extremely rare. Limiteds were treated to a very luxurious interior with [[plush]] [[carpeting]] and optional bench pillow seats and a [[Gear stick|column shift]]. The 1987 model would be the end of the manufacture of the [[Rear wheel drive|RWD]] "G-Body" Regal, but [[General Motors|GM]] had to extend the build of the Grand National to meet customer demand into December. [[File:Buick GNX (20206519195).jpg|thumb|Buick Regal GNX]] [[File:Buick GNX (20180268696).jpg|thumb|GNX rear view]] For the final year, 1987, Buick introduced the limited production GNX, for "Grand National Experimental", at $29,900. Made in partnership with [[Linamar|McLaren Performance Technologies]]/[[American Specialty Cars|ASC]], Buick produced only 547 GNs with the interior trim package, that were then sent off to [[McLaren Automotive|McLaren]] and upgraded into the Buick GNX. Buick underrated the GNX at {{Convert|276|hp|PS kW|0|abbr=on}} @ 4,400 rpm and a very substantial {{convert|360|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} @ 3,000 rpm of [[Torque#Machine torque|torque]],{{cite web |url=https://www.carfolio.com/specifications/models/car/?car=100661 |title=1987 Buick Regal GNX |website=Carfolio.com |accessdate=2018-09-23 |date=2013-02-28}} although actual output is {{convert|300|bhp|PS kW|0|abbr=on}} and {{convert|420|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}}.{{cite web|url=http://home.att.net/~buickGNX/GNX/perf.htm |title=GNX Performance |work=BuickGNX.com |accessdate=2007-07-10 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070630104145/http://home.att.net/~buickGNX/GNX/perf.htm |archivedate=June 30, 2007 }} This was created to be the "Grand National to end all Grand Nationals." Changes made included a special [[Garrett AiResearch]] T-3 [[turbocharger]] with a [[ceramic]]-impeller blowing through a more efficient and significantly larger capacity [[intercooler]] with a "Cermatel (ceramic-aluminum) coated" pipe connecting the intercooler to the engine. A GNX specific E-EPROM, low-restriction exhaust with dual [[muffler]]s, reprogrammed turbo Hydramatic 200-4R transmission with a custom [[torque converter]] and transmission cooler, and unique [[Differential (mechanical device)|differential]] cover/[[Panhard]] bar included more of the performance modifications. Exterior styling changes include vents located on each front [[Fender (vehicle)|fender]], 16 inch black mesh style wheels with VR-speed rated tires, and deletion of the hood and fender emblems. The interior changes of the GNX included a serial number on the dash plaque and a revised instrument cluster providing [[Stewart-Warner]] [[Analog device|analog gauges]], including an analog turbo [[boost gauge]]. Performance was measured faster than the [[Ferrari F40]] and the [[Porsche 930]] with a [[Dragstrip|{{convert|1/4|mi|m|0}}]] time of 12.7 seconds at {{Convert|113.1|mi/h|km/h|0|abbr=on}} (0.3 and 0.8 seconds quicker, 2.9 and {{convert|13.3|mph|0|abbr=on}} faster) and a 0-{{convert|60|mph|km/h|0|abbr=on}} time of 4.6 seconds (0.4 and 0.3 seconds quicker, respectively).[http://imgur.com/gallery/uzXOy], ''MotorTrend'', accessed Aug 11, 2016. GNX #001 is the 1986 prototype currently owned by Buick and sometimes makes appearances at car shows around the US. The GNX used a unique [[torque arm]] that was mounted to a special, GNX only, rear differential cover, for increased [[Traction (engineering)|traction]]. The torque arm rear suspension alters the suspension geometry, making the body lift while planting the rear tires down, resulting in increased traction. The stealthy appearance of the all-black GNX and Grand National (and the resemblance of its grill to his helmet's mouthpiece), coupled with the fact that the Grand National was initially released during the popularity of ''[[Star Wars]]'' movies, earned it the title "[[Darth Vader]]'s Car". [[Car and Driver]] covered the GNX model's introduction with the headline "Lord Vader, your car is ready." Due to the six cylinder engine, the Buick make, and the black paint Grand Nationals were sometimes referred to as the "Dark Side". The "Dark Side" contrasted with the more common V8 [[Ford Mustang (third generation)|Mustangs]] and Camaros that were popular at the time. {{Clear}} == Third generation (1988–1996) == {{Infobox automobile | name = Third generation | image = Buick gray.jpg | caption = 1988–1989 Buick Regal Limited coupe | model_years = 1988–1996 | production = 1987–October 1996https://www.cars.com/reviews/chicagotribunecoms-view-1420689074485/ | transmission = 4-speed automatic

[[Pontiac Grand Prix#Fifth generation .281988.E2.80.931996.29|Pontiac Grand Prix]] | platform = [[GM W platform|W-body]] | layout = [[FF layout]] | designer = | sp = us }} [[File:'88-'89 Buick Regal (Orange Julep).JPG|thumb|left|1988–1989 Buick Regal GS coupe]] [[File:Buick Regal 2 -- 10-30-2009.jpg|thumb|left|1990–1994 Buick Regal GS sedan]] [[File:1991 Buick Regal Limited.jpg|thumb|left|1991 Buick Regal Limited coupe]] [[File:Buick Regal coupe.jpg|thumb|left|1995–1996 Buick Regal coupe]] [[File:95-96 Buick Regal.jpg|thumb|left|1996 Buick Regal sedan]] A new Regal appeared in October 1987 on the [[GM W platform]] as the first vehicle on that platform;http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/ct-xpm-1987-08-30-8703050938-story.html this generation ran with few changes for nine years. Though the new Regal returned to Buick's original concept in being offered only as a coupe and in being aimed once again squarely at the personal luxury buyer, it departed from tradition in being the first front-wheel drive model, and in having no serious performance option or edition. Neither a [[V8 engine|V8]] engine nor a turbocharged [[V6]] was offered; the only engine available for 1988 was the Chevrolet 2.8 L V6, producing {{convert|125|hp|abbr=on}}. From 1990, owing to the declining personal luxury car market, the Regal was again offered as a four-door [[sedan (car)|sedan]] (as were the Cutlass Supreme and Grand Prix the same year, the latter offered as a sedan for the first time). The Regal was initially offered in base ''Custom'' and upscale ''Limited'' trim lines. For 1989, the ''[[Buick Gran Sport#Regal GS / Regal Gran Sport|Gran Sport]]'' trim line was added, featuring aluminum wheels, body side cladding and a console mounted shifter attached to the 4-speed automatic. For 1990, the Regal gained the option of the Buick 3.8 L V6. The 3800 V6 was unique to the Regal, differentiating it from the mechanically similar [[Chevrolet Lumina]], [[Oldsmobile Cutlass Supreme]] and [[Pontiac Grand Prix]]. Anti-lock brakes were made standard on all but the base ''Custom'' cars from 1992, and the grille was redesigned again for 1993. Along with the new look came an electronically controlled [[automatic transmission]] and [[Buick LeSabre|LeSabre]]-like rear lights and bumper. For 1993, a driver's side [[airbag]] was added, along with standard [[Anti-lock braking system|ABS]] on all models, standard power windows, and {{convert|20|hp|0|abbr=on}} more in the base engine due to a revised intake manifold and cylinder head. The ''Limited'' coupe was deleted; only the ''Custom'' and ''Gran Sport (GS)'' coupes remained. Dual airbags were new for 1995 along with a new interior. For 1996, the larger {{convert|3791|cc|L CID|1|abbr=on|order=flip}} V6 engine became the ''3800 Series II'' and gained {{convert|35|hp|0|abbr=on}}. {{citation needed span|Although 1996 was the last model year of this model, sales continued into 1997 as the replacement model was late (arriving in January 1997).|date=October 2018}} === Engines === * 1988–1989 2.8 L (170 in³) [[GM 60-Degree V6 engine#Generation II|Chevrolet LB6]] [[MPFI|MFI]] [[V6]], {{Convert|125|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} and {{Convert|160|lbft|Nm|abbr=on}} * 1989–1993 3.1 L (191 in³) [[GM 60-Degree V6 engine#Generation II|Chevrolet LH0]] MFI V6, {{Convert|140|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} and {{Convert|180|lbft|Nm|abbr=on}} * 1994–1996 3.1 L (191 in³) [[GM 60-Degree V6 engine#Generation III|Chevrolet L82]] SFI V6, {{Convert|160|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} and {{Convert|185|lbft|Nm|abbr=on}} * 1990–1995 3.8 L (231 in³) [[L27 Naturally Aspirated|Buick L27]] V6, {{Convert|170|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} and {{Convert|220|lbft|Nm|abbr=on}} * 1996 3.8 L (231 in³) [[Buick V6 engine#L36 Naturally Aspirated|Buick L36]] V6, {{Convert|200|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} and {{Convert|225|lbft|Nm|abbr=on}} {{Clear}} == {{anchor|Fourth}} Fourth generation (1997–2004) == {{Infobox automobile | name = Fourth generation | image = Buick Regal GSE.jpg | caption = 1997–2004 Buick Regal GSE | aka = [[:zh:别克君威|别克君威]] (Buick Regal)

Wayne Kady (1993) | sp = us }} {{see also|Buick Century#1997–2005|l1=Buick Century § 1997–2005}} [[File:Buick Regal.jpg|thumb|left|1997–2004 Buick Regal sedan]] For the 1997 model year, the Century and Regal once again rode upon the same platform; the revised [[GM W platform|W platform]] that was shared with the [[Oldsmobile Intrigue]], the [[Pontiac Grand Prix]], the [[Chevrolet Lumina]] and [[Chevrolet Monte Carlo]].https://adage.com/article/news/buick-s-regal-read-costly-web-launch/263/ The Regal coupe was discontinued. Differences between the Regal and Century were mostly cosmetic. As the upmarket version, the Regal offered larger engines and fancier trim, and once again boasted a newer version of the 3.8 L V6. While the Century was mainly a reliable, economy-minded car based upon the W-body, the Regal was fitted with many amenities, including heated leather seats (optional on the Century), a [[Monsoon speakers|Monsoon]] 8-speaker surround sound system, dual climate control, and expansive interior space. Few changes occurred during this version's seven-year run. It offered 5-passenger seating on all trim levels like the Pontiac Grand Prix and Oldsmobile Intrigue (formerly Cutlass Supreme), unlike their predecessors that had optional 6-passenger seating and the Buick Century (formerly built on the [[GM A platform|A platform]]) which had standard 6-passenger seating. This period held the fastest Buick since the days of the 1991-1996 Roadmaster, the Buick Regal GS. This car was now [[supercharged]] instead of turbocharged, and produced {{convert|240|hp|abbr=on}} and {{convert|280|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} of torque. When introduced in January 1997http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/ct-xpm-1996-08-11-9608110276-story.html, Buick advertised the Regal as the "car for the supercharged family". Buick also released two other model types, the LSE and the GSE. The LSE stayed with the {{convert|200|hp|abbr=on}} engine with upgrades and the GSE stayed with the {{convert|240|hp|abbr=on}} supercharged engine with upgrades. Also, in 2000 Buick came out with a concept GSX that had an intercooled 3.8 L, but was supercharged rather than turbocharged. It had {{convert|295.24|hp|abbr=on}} The North American Regal was replaced in 2005 by the [[Buick LaCrosse]], also built on the W platform. The final 2004 Buick Regal rolled off the assembly line on June 1, 2004.{{cite book |title=Ward's Automotive Yearbook 2005 |publisher=Ward's Communications, Inc |year=2005 |page=112}} === Engines === * 1997–2004 [[GM 3800 engine#L36|3.8]] L L36 Series II [[V6]] * 1997–2004 [[GM 3800 engine#L67|3.8]] L L67 Series II supercharged [[V6]] === Regal LS and GS performance === [[File:Regal l67.jpg|thumb|left|The 3800 Series II L67 Supercharged engine in a 1998 GS]] The Regal LS from the factory had a 1/4 mile (~400 m) elapsed time (ET) of 15.8 seconds and could do 0-60 mph in under 8 seconds. The supercharged Regal GS had a 1/4 mile ET of 14.9 seconds, and acceleration to {{convert|60|mi/h|km/h|-1|abbr=on}} took 6.7 seconds.{{cite web |author=Albee Digital Communications |url=http://www.albeedigital.com/supercoupe/articles/0-60_Quarter_Mile_Times/B_0-60times.html |title="B" 0-60 and 1/4 mile times for Factory Stock Vehicles |publisher=Albeedigital.com |date= |accessdate=2009-06-28 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130410163805/http://www.albeedigital.com/supercoupe/articles/0-60_Quarter_Mile_Times/B_0-60times.html |archivedate=2013-04-10 |df= }} The Regal GS, equipped with the supercharged 3.8 liter V6 engine (L67) produced {{convert|240|hp|abbr=on}} & {{convert|280|lb·ft|N.m|abbr=on}} of torque. The Regal GS's PCM has programming that activates torque management to reduce wheel spin at launch. The Regal LS was EPA rated at 19/30 MPG city/freeway while the supercharged Regal GS was EPA rated at 18/27 MPG city/freeway. === Regal LSX and GSX (SLP Performance) === SLP Performance offered dealer-installed options and dealer supplied accessories for both LS and GS models. The three power train packages, referred to as stages, added between 15-30 HP. Performance tires, handling and braking, and lowering options were offered along with interior and exterior cosmetic options.{{cite web |url=http://www.fabini.com/slp/slpbuickgsx.html |title=SLP Buick Regal GSX |work=Fabini's Auto Trim Co |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110710215458/http://www.fabini.com/slp/slpbuickgsx.html |archivedate=2011-07-10 |df= }} ===Joseph Abboud Edition=== From 2001 to 2004 Buick offered a [[Joseph Abboud]] appearance package on both the GS and LS models. This package included either a solid [[taupe]] or two-tone taupe/[[Chestnut (color)|chestnut]] leather seats, two-tone leather wrapped steering wheel, leather shifter handle and boot, 16" aluminum wheels; and Joseph Abboud signature emblems on the front doors, floor mats, front seat head rests, and taillights. === China === [[File:Buick Regal CN 01 China 2012-06-16.jpg|thumb|left|1999–2008 Buick Regal front (China)]] [[File:Buick Regal CN 02 China 2012-06-16.jpg|thumb|right||1999–2008 Buick Regal rear (China)]] General Motors and [[Shanghai Automotive Industry Corporation]] (SAIC) established a joint venture in 1997 called [[Shanghai GM]], and had begun assembling the Buick Regal in [[Shanghai]], [[People's Republic of China|China]] in April 1999.{{cite web |url=http://history.gmheritagecenter.com/wiki/index.php/1995%2C_GM_Links_with_SAIC |title=1995, GM Links with SAIC |year=2011 |work=history.gmheritagecenter.com |publisher=General Motors Company |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5z3cvAY0i?url=http://history.gmheritagecenter.com/wiki/index.php/1995,_GM_Links_with_SAIC# |archivedate=2011-05-30 |accessdate=2011-05-30 |quote=GM signed a milestone agreement with China’s Shanghai Automotive Industry Corporation (SAIC) for a proposed automotive joint venture, a joint venture technical center, and several other projects in and around the city of Shanghai... |deadurl=yes |df= }}{{cite web |url=http://history.gmheritagecenter.com/wiki/index.php/1982_-1999,_Globalization,_One_Company,_One_Team |title=1982 -1999, Globalization, One Company, One Team |year=2011 |work=history.gmheritagecenter.com |publisher=General Motors Company |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5z3Uy5pg2?url=http://history.gmheritagecenter.com/wiki/index.php/1982_-1999,_Globalization,_One_Company,_One_Team# |archivedate=2011-05-30 |accessdate=2011-05-30 |quote=Also in 1995, the company entered into a joint venture agreement with Shanghai Automotive Industry Corporation (SAIC) in China, laying the foundation for unprecedented growth over the next few years. Four years later, the Buick Regal was being assembled in China for the Chinese market... |deadurl=yes |df= }}{{cite web |url=http://history.gmheritagecenter.com/wiki/index.php/1999,_Buick_is_Back_in_Shanghai |title=1999, Buick is Back in Shanghai |year=2011 |work=history.gmheritagecenter.com |publisher=General Motors Company |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5z3V6i6Em?url=http://history.gmheritagecenter.com/wiki/index.php/1999,_Buick_is_Back_in_Shanghai# |archivedate=2011-05-30 |accessdate=2011-05-30 |quote=The General Motors-SAIC joint venture plant in Shanghai began building Buick Regals for the Chinese market, marking the Buick brand’s proud return to China. |deadurl=yes |df= }} The Regal has sold well in the Chinese market as a large, relatively luxurious model, despite its high price, costing more than the North American version. The Chinese market Regal has slightly different frontal sheetmetal compared to the North American version and different engines including the 2.0 L ''[[Family II engine#L34|L34]]'', the 2.5 L ''[[GM 60-Degree V6 engine#LB8|LB8]]'' V6 and the 3.0 L ''[[GM 60-Degree V6 engine#LW9|LW9]]'' V6. Gearbox choices were a 4 speed automatic for V6 models while four cylinder variants are paired with a 5 speed manual gearbox. V6 models had a set of black dashboard gauges while the four cylinder models had white dashboard gauges. These models also had slightly different names: the entry-level model was the ''New Century'', with more upscale models carrying the ''GL'' and ''GLX'' names. Later, ''G'' and ''GS'' models were added. Production for this generation ended in November 2008 in China being replaced the Opel Insignia based Regal. {{clear}} == Fifth generation (2008–2017) == {{Infobox automobile | name = Fifth generation | image = 2011 Buick Regal -- 07-04-2011.jpg | caption = 2011 Buick Regal CXL | aka = [[Opel Insignia]]

{{Convert|3671|lbs|abbr=on}} (2011 CXL Turbo) | sp = us | predecessor = [[Buick LaCrosse#First generation (2005–2009)|Buick LaCrosse]] | successor = }} {{See also|Opel Insignia}} [[File:Buick (12645920815).jpg|thumb|left|Buick Regal]] The fifth-generation Buick Regal is a four-door, five-passenger, [[Mid-size car|midsized]] [[Sedan (automobile)|sedan]] with a [[FF layout|front engine, front-wheel drive]] layout.{{cite web |url=http://www.fueleconomy.gov/feg/2008car1tablef.jsp?id=30075 |title=2011 Buick Regal |year=2011 |work=fueleconomy.gov |publisher=United States Environmental Protection Agency |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5z4Zdiz4X?url=http://www.fueleconomy.gov/feg/2008car1tablef.jsp?id=30075 |archivedate=2011-05-30 |accessdate=2011-05-30 |quote=Size Class Midsize Cars |deadurl=yes |df= }} GM says that the Regal is helping General Motors attract new, younger customers to the Buick brand. According to GM published information, more than 41% of Regal buyers in the US are coming from non-General Motors brands, and more than 60% of CXL Turbo buyers are under the age of 55.{{cite press release |url=http://media.gm.com/content/media/us/en/gm/news.detail.html/content/Pages/news/us/en/2011/Jan/0128_regalturbo |title=Buick Regal Turbo Attracting New Customers to Brand |date=2011-01-28 |publisher=General Motors Company |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5z4fIzo1V?url=http://media.gm.com/content/media/us/en/gm/news.detail.html/content/Pages/news/us/en/2011/Jan/0128_regalturbo |archivedate=2011-05-30 |accessdate=2011-05-30 |quote=More than 60 percent of Regal Turbo customers alone are younger than 55, according to Power Information Network data. Since its launch last spring, 41 percent of Regal’s buyers have come from non-GM brands. |deadurl=yes |df= }} === Development === The fifth generation Buick Regal rides on GM's [[GM Epsilon II platform|Epsilon II]] platform and is mostly identical to the [[Opel Insignia]]. It first went into production in [[Rüsselsheim]], Germany, in 2008.{{cite web |url=http://www.motortrend.com/roadtests/sedans/112_0911_2011_buick_regal/index.html |title=2011 Buick Regal |first=Todd |last=Lassa |date=November 2009 |work=motortrend.com |publisher=MotorTrend Magazine, Source Interlink Media |page=1 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5z4ZEcVDR?url=http://www.motortrend.com/roadtests/sedans/112_0911_2011_buick_regal/specs.html |archivedate=2011-05-30 |accessdate=2011-05-30 |quote=...GM planned to make the Opel Insignia Saturn's second-generation Aura. |deadurl=yes |df= }}{{cite web |url=http://paultan.org/2008/11/05/new-buick-regal-for-china-based-on-insignia/ |title=New Buick Regal for China based on Insignia |first=Paul |last=Tan |date=2008-11-05 |work=Paul Tan's Automotive News |publisher=Driven Media Sdn Bhd |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5z2AQjmKK?url=http://paultan.org/2008/11/05/new-buick-regal-for-china-based-on-insignia/ |archivedate=2011-05-29 |accessdate=2011-05-29 |quote=The new Opel Insignia (badged as a Vauxhall in the UK) is now in China, badged as a Buick. The Insignia is wearing the Buick Regal badge... |deadurl=yes |df= }} The [[Shanghai GM]] twin of the Insignia was introduced in China as Buick Regal in December, 2008 for the 2009 model year. GM originally planned to sell a modified version of the Opel Insignia in North America as the second generation [[Saturn Aura]], but changed strategy after deciding to discontinue the [[Saturn Corporation|Saturn]] brand.{{cite web |url=http://www.autonews.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20110518/OEM04/110519901/1266 |title=Buick will get rebadged, redesigned Astra, report says |first=Rick |last=Kranz |date=2011-05-18 |work=autonews.com |publisher=Crain Communications, Inc |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5z563fWtM?url=http://www.autonews.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=%2F20110518%2FOEM04%2F110519901%2F1266 |archivedate=2011-05-31 |accessdate=2011-05-30 |quote=With Saturn's demise, Buick was selected to market a few rebadged Opel cars. For example, the current Insignia is marketed here as the Buick Regal, a key vehicle in the brand's turnaround. |deadurl=yes |df= }} The Regal utilizes [[Monocoque|unibody]] construction with [[galvanization|galvanized]] steel front fenders, hood, roof and door panels and [[Thermoplastic olefin|thermoplastic polyolefin]] (TPO) bumper covers. The North American Regal weighs about 13 pounds more than an equivalent Opel Insignia due to increased structural support in the [[Pillar (car)|B-pillar]] necessary to meet U.S. [[rollover]] standards.{{cite web|url=http://www.motortrend.com/roadtests/sedans/112_0911_2011_buick_regal/index.html|title=2011 Buick Regal|last=Lassa|first=Todd|date=November 2009|publisher=MotorTrend Magazine, Source Interlink Media|page=2|quote=The 2.4 comes with a GM Hydra-Matic 6T45 six-speed automatic, while the turbo comes with an Aisin AF40 six-speed automatic.|work=motortrend.com|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5z4VtdlaS?url=http://www.motortrend.com/roadtests/sedans/112_0911_2011_buick_regal/engines.html|archivedate=2011-05-30|accessdate=2011-05-30|deadurl=yes|df=}} === Marketing === GM revealed the fifth generation Regal to North American dealers on October 14, 2009, and introduced the Regal to the public in November, 2009 at the [[LA Auto Show]].{{cite press release |url=http://archives.media.gm.com/archive/documents/domain_2/docId_57405_pr.html |title=Regal Named as Next Buick Sedan |date=2010-10-04 |publisher=General Motors Company |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5z4e8SLa1?url=http://archives.media.gm.com/archive/documents/domain_2/docId_57405_pr.html |archivedate=2011-05-30 |accessdate=2011-05-30 |quote=...more than 1,000 dealers this week will be the first to learn the name of Buick’s next mid-size sport sedan will be the Buick Regal. |deadurl=yes |df= }} Sales of the Regal began in February 2010. In North America, the Regal is positioned below the larger, more expensive [[Buick LaCrosse|LaCrosse]] and above the [[Buick Verano|Verano]] compact sedan which debuted late in calendar year 2011. === Production === [[File:Buick Regal - China.jpg|thumb|left|Chinese variant of the Regal]] Production of the [[Shanghai GM]] variant of the Regal began in November 2008 and ended in July 2017. North American production at [[General Motors of Canada]]'s [[Oshawa, Ontario]], assembly plant was confirmed on November 25, 2009, and production began at [[Oshawa Car Assembly]] in February 2011. The initial production for the North American market was done together with its Opel twin the [[Opel Insignia]] in the [[Adam Opel AG]]'s [[Rüsselsheim]], Germany assembly plant from 1 March 2010 to 25 March 2011 (33,669 cars in 2010 and 12,637 in 2011).Production period according to a Foto on display at the Opel plant as seen on September 22, 2012, during the Open House on occasion of the 150-year Opel jubilee === Trim Levels === ==== {{anchor|CXL and CXL Turbo}} CXL ==== The Regal debuted in North America with a single engine, the 2.4L DOHC I4 engine and was rated at {{Convert|182|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} and {{convert|172|lbft|Nm|0}} of torque. The 2.4L engine is mated to a GM [[Hydramatic|Hydra-Matic]] 6T45 six-speed The 2011 Regal produced in North America was offered in one trim level, called CXL, and was offered with two engine choices and seven option packages. Buick had planned to offer a lower-level trim called CX with cloth seats and a higher level trim called CXS, but those trim levels have not yet been offered.{{cite web |url=http://www.motortrend.com/roadtests/sedans/112_0911_2011_buick_regal/future_plans.html |title=2011 Buick Regal |first=Todd |last=Lassa |date=November 2009 |work=motortrend.com |publisher=MotorTrend Magazine, Source Interlink Media |page=3 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5z4YVbINn?url=http://www.motortrend.com/roadtests/sedans/112_0911_2011_buick_regal/future_plans.html |archivedate=2011-05-30 |accessdate=2011-05-30 |quote=...Buick will add base, cloth-seat CX and high-zoot CXS trim levels. |deadurl=yes |df= }} ==== CXL Turbo ==== The CXL Turbo comes equipped with a [[turbocharger|turbocharged]] 2.0L direct-injected [[GM Ecotec engine|Ecotec]] DOHC I4 rated at {{Convert|220|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} and {{convert|258|lbft|Nm|0}} of torque, mated to either an [[Aisin Seiki Co.#Aisin AW|Aisin]] [[AWTF-80 SC|AF40]] 6-speed automatic or a 6-speed [[manual transmission]], making the Regal Turbo the first Buick model to be offered with a manual transmission since the [[Buick Skyhawk]] ended production in 1989. The 2.0L turbo is the first direct-injected turbocharged production car capable of running on any blend of gasoline or E85 ethanol.{{cite press release |url=http://media.gm.com/content/media/us/en/gm/news.detail.html/content/Pages/news/us/en/2011/Feb/0221_regalturbo |title=Buick Regal Turbo Gets Industry-First Turbo Direct-Injected Engine with Flex-Fuel Capability |date=2011-02-21 |publisher=General Motors Company |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5z4gcFkpx?url=http://media.gm.com/content/media/us/en/gm/news.detail.html/content/Pages/news/us/en/2011/Feb/0221_regalturbo |archivedate=2011-05-30 |accessdate=2011-05-30 |quote=The 2011 Buick Regal Turbo is the first direct-injected turbocharged production car capable of running on any blend of gasoline or E85 ethanol... |deadurl=yes |df= }} ==== GS ==== [[File:2011 Buick Verano (5490346021).jpg|thumb|left|2011 Buick Regal GS]] At the 2010 [[North American International Auto Show]] in Detroit, GM showed a concept GS version of the Regal based on the Opel Insignia [[Opel Performance Center|OPC]] and the Vauxhall Insignia VXR. The concept featured a 2.0L, {{convert|270|hp|kW|abbr=on}}, {{convert|295|lbft|abbr=on}} high-output DOHC I4 turbocharged Ecotec engine, a 6-speed manual transmission and all-wheel drive. The production GS leaves most of the concept specifications intact, but is front-wheel drive. The GS features Buick's Interactive Drive Control System with GS mode, a choice of an FGP Germany F40-6 six-speed manual or Aisin AF-40 (G2) six-speed automatic transmission, high performance brakes with Brembo front calipers and high performance strut (HiPerStrut) front suspension. 19 inch wheels will be standard and 20 inch forged aluminum wheels will be available. The GS is expected to accelerate from zero to 60 miles per hour in under seven seconds. The production version is equipped with GS-only high-output version of the Ecotec 2.0L turbo engine with {{Convert|270|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} and {{convert|295|lbft|abbr=on}} of torque. The GM LHU engine used in the GS trim makes 135 hp per liter - Buick’s highest specific output ever.{{cite web |last=Harman |first=Dan |title=Buick Regal |date=2014-02-05 |url=http://www.mojomotors.com/review/buick-regal/ |publisher=Mojo Motors |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6NA6CL8No?url=http://www.mojomotors.com/review/buick-regal/ |archivedate=2014-02-05 |accessdate=2014-02-05 |deadurl=yes |df= }} The GS went on sale in fall 2011 as a 2012 model.{{cite press release|title=Buick Regal GS Production Model Takes Sports Sedan Performance To A New Level For Buick|date=2010-11-04|publisher=General Motors Company|url=http://media.gm.com/content/media/us/en/news/news_detail.brand_gm.html/content/Pages/news/us/en/2010/Nov/1104_gm_regal_gs|quote=Body style/driveline: four-door, five-passenger, front-engine transaxle. Front-wheel drive midsize sedan|accessdate=2011-05-30|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5z4bTpn44?url=http://media.gm.com/content/media/us/en/news/news_detail.brand_gm.html/content/Pages/news/us/en/2010/Nov/1104_gm_regal_gs|archivedate=2011-05-30|deadurl=yes|df=}}{{cite web |url=http://www.caranddriver.com/features/10q1/2012_buick_regal_gs-feature |title=2012 Buick Regal GS - Feature |date=April 2010 |work=caranddriver.com |publisher=Hachette Filipacchi Media U.S., Inc |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5z4cOkeJx?url=http://www.caranddriver.com/features/10q1/2012_buick_regal_gs-feature |archivedate=2011-05-30 |accessdate=2011-05-30 |quote=While Europeans will get an Insignia OPC with a {{Convert|325|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}}, turbocharged V-6, the GS gets a higher-output version of the 2.0-liter turbo four found in the Regal. |deadurl=yes |df= }} The [[Shanghai GM]] variant of Regal GS went on sale in China on September 15, 2011. This car has been localized. The output of the 2.0L Turbo SIDI engine is {{Convert|162|kW|hp|0|abbr=on}}, which is about 40 kW less than the production US-model. The Torque is {{convert|350|Nm|lbft|0}}. and the top speed is claimed as 232 km/h. The car is only offered in this case as a front-wheel-drive. There exist also some interior and exterior differences between the American and Chinese models.{{cite web |url=http://www.buick.com.cn/RegalGS/ |title=2015款新君威GS 焕新登场 |publisher=Buick China |language=Chinese |date= |accessdate=2015-03-21}}{{cite web | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20120131073541/http://buick.com.cn/RegalGS/specifications.aspx | url=http://www.buick.com.cn/RegalGS/specifications.aspx |title=别克官方网站--君威GS·智驱豹-价格配置 |publisher=Buick China | archivedate = 2012-01-31 | date= September 2011 | language=Chinese}} ==== Sport Touring Edition ==== For 2016, the Regal added a new Sport Touring Edition which included unique 18" aluminum black pocket wheels and a rear lip spoiler. ==== eAssist ==== [[File:2012 Buick Regal eAssist WAS 2012 0830.JPG|thumb|2012 Buick Regal with optional [[BAS Hybrid#Generation II BAS (eAssist)|eAssist]] hybrid system]] Beginning in 2011, Buick began offering the [[BAS Hybrid#Generation II BAS (eAssist)|eAssist]] system in the Regal, The 2012 [[model year]] Regal is the second GM vehicle to offer eAssist after the 2012 [[Buick LaCrosse]]. The eAssist system is standard in the LaCrosse, but the eAssist powertrain is optional in the Regal. The eAssist system adds a lithium-ion battery housed in the trunk, along with regenerative braking, engine stop/start, fuel cut-off, grille louvres that close at speed, underbody panels and low-rolling resistance tires. The eAssist system adds up to {{convert|15|hp|kW|abbr=on}} to the standard 2.4L Ecotec engine during acceleration. Fuel economy for the Regal with eAssist is estimated at {{convert|26|mpgus|abbr=on}} city, {{convert|37|mpgus|abbr=on}} highway.{{cite press release |url=http://media.gm.com/content/media/us/en/gm/news.detail.html/content/Pages/news/us/en/2011/Feb/11chicago/buick/0208_Regal_eA |title=2012 Regal to Offer New eAssist™ Fuel-Saving Technology |date=2011-02-08 |publisher=General Motors Company |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5z4n9b1i5?url=http://media.gm.com/content/media/us/en/gm/news.detail.html/content/Pages/news/us/en/2011/Feb/11chicago/buick/0208_Regal_eA |archivedate=2011-05-30 |accessdate=2011-05-30 |quote=Mated to Regal’s 2.4L Ecotec direct injection four-cylinder engine and next-generation six-speed automatic transmission... |deadurl=yes |df= }} === 2014 Update === [[File:2014 Regal.JPG|thumb|2014 Buick Regal eAssist]] GM revealed an updated 2014 Regal at the 2013 [[New York Auto Show]]. Changes include a revised interior and exterior, a boost in performance for the CXL Turbo up to 258 hp (192 kW) and 295 lb·ft (400 N·m) of torque, and an available all-wheel drive option offered for the 2.0L engine/6-speed automatic transmission equipped vehicles. Changes for the GS include revised interior and exterior, a drop in power to match that of the CXL Turbo, and available an all-wheel drive option offered for the 2.0L / six-speed automatic transmission equipped vehicles. The six-speed manual transmission is still offered, but only in the front-wheel drive variant. Buick's [[Buick#VentiPorts|VentiPorts]] have reappeared starting with 2014 models, a styling feature unique to Buick that dates back to 1949. Several new safety features were added for the 2014 year, which include forward collision warning, lane-departure warning, blind-spot monitoring, rear cross-traffic alert, and a following-distance indicator. The foregoing are all part of a Driver Confidence package, while collision preparation, which pre-loads the brake system ahead of an imminent collision, and adaptive cruise control are available separately.{{cite web|last=Lamm|first=John|title=2014 Buick Regal / Regal GS|url=http://www.caranddriver.com/news/2014-buick-regal-photos-and-info-news|work=Car and Driver|accessdate=3 October 2013}} {| class="wikitable" ! colspan="6" |Shanghai GM Regal Engines (Petrol) |- !Engine model !Type !Displacement !Power !Torque !Year |- ![[GM Family 1 engine#Generation III|'''1.6T''']] | rowspan="5" |I4 |1,598 cc |{{Convert|179|PS|kW hp|abbr=on}} at 5,800 rpm |{{Convert|220|Nm|lbft|abbr=on}} at 2,200–5,400 rpm | rowspan="3" |2008–2017 |- ![[GM Family II engine|2.0]] |1,998 cc |{{Convert|147|PS|kW hp|abbr=on}} at 6,200 rpm |{{Convert|190|Nm|lbft|abbr=on}} at 4,600 rpm |- ![[GM Ecotec engine#LDK|2.0T SIDI]] |1,998 cc |220 PS (162 kW; 218 hp) at 5,300 rpm |{{Convert|350|Nm|lbft|abbr=on}} at 2,000–4,000 rpm |- ![[GM Ecotec engine#LE5|2.4]] |2,384 cc |170 PS (125 kW; 168 hp) at 6,400 rpm |{{Convert|225|Nm|lbft|abbr=on}} at 4,800 rpm |2008–2010 |- ![[GM Ecotec engine#LAF|2.4 SIDI]] |2,384 cc |{{Convert|186|PS|kW hp|abbr=on}} at 6,200 rpm |{{Convert|240|Nm|lbft|abbr=on}} at 4,800 rpm |2011–2017 |} {{Clear}} == Sixth generation (2018–present) == {{Infobox automobile | name = Sixth generation | image = 2018 Buick Regal Sportback Preferred II FWD, Ebony Twilight Metallic, front right.jpg | caption = 2018 Buick Regal Sportback | aka = {{unbulleted list|[[:zh:别克君威|别克君威]] (Buick Regal; China)|[[Opel Insignia]] (Europe)|[[Vauxhall Motors|Vauxhall]] Insignia (United Kingdom)|[[Holden Commodore (ZB)]] (Australia)}} | production = 2017–present | model_years = 2018–present | assembly = [[Germany]]: [[Rüsselsheim am Main|Rüsselsheim]]

{{convert|58.4|in|mm|abbr=on}} (TourX) | sp = us }} On April 4, 2017, an all-new sixth generation Buick Regal was introduced at GM's Design Dome in [[Warren, Michigan]] as a 2018 model in both [[Hatchback|liftback]] and station wagon versions. Buick Regal began sales in China on July 21, 2017.[http://media.gm.com/media/cn/en/buick/vehicles/All-New-Buick-Regal/2017.html "All-New Buick Regal"], ''Buick News China'', Retrieved on 16 August 2017. Similar to the previous generation, it is related to the [[Opel Insignia|Opel and Vauxhall Insignia]] sold in Europe and [[Holden Commodore (ZB)|Holden ZB Commodore]] in Australia, and like the previous generation, the vehicles were developed and are produced in Germany. ===Regal Sportback=== [[File:Buick Regal 2.0T IMG 20180417 111121.jpg|thumb|left|Rear view]] The fastback version of the Regal, now branded as Regal Sportback, is the replacement for the Regal sedan. While the roofline is similar to that of its predecessor, the new liftback configuration provides added utility. It has grown larger in size, and is around 300 to 500 pounds lighter than the previous Regal.{{cite web|title=2017 Buick Regal Will Be Lighter, Longer Than Current Model|url=http://gmauthority.com/blog/2015/07/2017-buick-regal-will-be-lighter-longer-than-current-model/|last=Singer|first=Drew|website=GM Authority|date=July 30, 2016|accessdate=August 6, 2016}} It carries two versions of the ''[[GM Ecotec engine#LTG|LTG]]'' 2.0 L [[Turbocharged]] [[inline-4]] engine. [[Front-wheel drive]] models produce {{convert|250|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} @ 5400 rpm and {{convert|260|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} @ 2000 rpm, while the [[all-wheel drive]] model produces {{convert|250|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} @ 5500 and {{convert|295|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} @ 3000 rpm, respectively.{{cite web|title=2018 Buick Regal spy shots|url=http://www.motorauthority.com/news/1102584_2018-buick-regal-spy-shots|last=Vijayenthiran|first=Viknesh|website=Motor Authority|date=February 27, 2016|accessdate=August 6, 2016}} ===Regal TourX=== [[File:2018 Buick Regal TourX Preferred AWD, rear right.jpg|thumb|left|2018 Buick Regal TourX]] The station wagon variant, named Regal TourX, was also introduced and went on sale at the same time as the hatchback, marking the first time since the demise of the [[Buick Roadmaster|Roadmaster]] in 1996 that Buick had a station wagon in its lineup. The TourX competes against the [[Volvo V60 Cross Country]], [[Audi A4 Allroad]], [[Subaru Outback]], and [[BMW 3 Series (F30)|BMW 3 Series wagon]], and offers up to 73.5 cubic feet of storage space behind the front seats, but only comes in all-wheel drive, along with a ''[[GM Ecotec engine#LTG|LTG]]'' turbocharged 2.0-liter four-cylinder producing an estimated {{convert|250|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} and {{convert|295|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} mated with an eight-speed automatic transmission. The TourX is not available in Canada. ===GS=== [[File:Buick Regal II GS 001.jpg|thumb|left|Buick Regal GS front]] [[File:Buick Regal II GS 002.jpg|thumb|left|Buick Regal GS rear]] The 2018 GS is the performance version of sixth generation Regal. This generation of GS sports a 3.6 liter [[GM High Feature engine|LGX]] V6 engine producing 310 hp, signals return of V6 usage in a mid-size Buick after a hiatus of 13 years. This V6 engine makes GS the most powerful production Buick, (along with the [[Buick LaCrosse|third generation LaCrosse]]). {{clear}} == Sales == {| class="wikitable" |- ! Calendar year !! [[File:Clothes swapping.jpg|thumb|A clothing swap in [[Toronto]]]]
A '''clothing swap''' is a type of [[swapmeet]] wherein participants exchange their valued but no longer used [[clothing]] for clothing they will use. Clothing swaps are considered not only a good way to refill one's wardrobe, but also are considered an act of environmentalism.<ref>http://www.onegreenplanet.org/lifestyle/how-clothing-swaps-could-help-save-the-world/</ref> It is also used to get rid of and obtain specialist clothing. Cloth swap can be specialized - they can cater for example for clothes swaps only for high end brands.<ref>https://www.stylewe.com/category/sweater-dresses-59_230</ref>
== Description ==
The notion of swapping is not a new concept; however, many groups and organizations exist that hold clothing swaps, in a variety of sizes, to raise money and clothes for charitable donations.<ref>https://www.theguardian.com/lifeandstyle/2014/sep/15/how-to-set-up-clothes-swap-in-your-area</ref>
Clothes swaps originated in San Francisco California with events hosted by Suzanne Agasi in the late nineties.<ref>http://business.time.com/2009/09/22/qa-with-clothing-swap-founder-suzanne-agasi/</ref>
Online clothes swapping has also become popular, with websites offering an environmentally friendly and frugal alternative to shopping or second-hand shops.
